intro: Cardamine impatiens var. longipes, commonly known as the long-stemmed watercress, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to moist, shaded environments in temperate regions. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, cruciform flowers and pinnately divided leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 15–30 cm, with slender stems that often root at the nodes. Its leaves are alternate, with a distinctive, elongated shape and a waxy surface that aids in water retention. The flowers are pale yellow to white, appearing in clusters and attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
